intro: Mollia lepidota, commonly known as the hairy mollia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Mollia lepidota is often found in moist, shaded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
